channel.title: Script executable?
channel.description: Is it possible to make like an executable scar script??, so it just runs the script right away without having to have it open scar and then pressing play, it would be a awesome if there was a way. I'm sure u could do this in visual basic but i don't know VB language and stuff and don't really feel like learning it, that is not yet :cool:, anyways but yea, possible?

item.title: Script executable?
item.dc:creator: @deathbyvirus deathbyvirus
item.description:
@deathbyvirus wrote:

meh, for some reason i enjoy learning lol, some people call me weird but i don’t care i like to know a lot of stuff, so i’m always up for learning new languages, and other stuff

Read full topic

item.title: Script executable?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Try this link.

I really don’t know why you would want to make a script into an executable, it isn’t no easy task and would probably take at least a month of studying to do so.

Read full topic

item.title: Script executable?
item.dc:creator: @deathbyvirus deathbyvirus
item.description:
@deathbyvirus wrote:

i tried to get delphi, couldn’t find it, any help?

atm i’m using this old school prog, looks like its from the 90’s lol, its FreePascal lol, its possibly the best program i’ve ever used winks

Read full topic

item.title: Script executable?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

It’s been discussed before.

The most easiest suggestion:- port the script to something like Delphi, with custom library’s for functions and procedures in your script not included in Delphi.

Once you’ve got every function covered, you can easily make an application to convert a scar script to your new delphi app.

Read full topic

item.description:

no offence, but its kinda my own project, seeing if i can do it

ok thanks bobert, and yea i’m on wiki lookin up pascal, its pretty close to scar’s pascal

oo yea i wanna look into delphi sometime to, that’d be cool

oo haha nvm delphi is a pascal compiler lol

item.title: Script executable?
item.dc:creator: @deathbyvirus deathbyvirus
item.description:
@deathbyvirus wrote:

hmm ok thanks for the help, yea i’m sure wait will be no problem at all, forms on the other hand i’m guessing i’l have some problems with, ok so lets say i’ve figured it out how to do it in regular pascal right?, now what do i do? to i make a text file and write my code in that then save it as a .exe?

btw thanks for the help

Read full topic

item.title: Script executable?
item.dc:creator: @bobert5696 bobert5696
item.description:
@bobert5696 wrote:

then just google pascal tutorials, i wouldnt know how to do it, as i said, my pascal knowledge outside of scar is 0, but i think wait, and keyup/down would be fairly simple to do, i just have no idea how to… i suggest googling like pascal programming forum, and asking for help there

Read full topic

item.title: Script executable?
item.dc:creator: @bobert5696 bobert5696
item.description:
@bobert5696 wrote:

exactly, since you don’t have the source to scar, remaking most SCAR functions would be a challenge without a lot of pascal knowledge… findcolor would probably be easier, but my pascal knowledge doesnt go any farther then scar, so i cant help you with it, it would honestly be pointless to do…

Read full topic

item.title: Script executable?
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

Don’t bother. It would be like a month of work (for you :rolleyes:)

EDIT: Oh and all those SCAR only functions and procedures like FindDeformedBitmapToleranceIn or even FindColor wouldn’t be easy to remake.

Read full topic

item.title: Script executable?
item.dc:creator: @bobert5696 bobert5696
item.description:
@bobert5696 wrote:

actually, yes you can, you just need to port every scar and SRL function into regular pascal, then make your script, and compile it, not worth the time it would take, so for the everyday person, no, you cant
